revised_title: Anatomy and Classification of Sigillaria scutellata and Eusigillarian Stems
tldr: This study examines the structure and anatomy of Sigillaria scutellata and other Eusigillarian stems, providing insights into their classification and relationship to other Paleozoic lycopods. The research is based on petrified specimens from the Lower Coal Measures of Shore-Littleborough in Lancashire, revealing details of the stems' structure, including the presence of a well-marked pith, scalariform tracheides, and a unique ribbing pattern.
